original_title: Sri Lanka to establish high commission in New Zealand
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka will establish a High Commission in Wellington, New Zealand, cabinet spokesman Dr Bandula Gunawardena said.

“There’s a lot of ties between Sri Lanka and New Zealand; a lot of our young people are studying there, we import milk powder from there, and we have many tourists coming from there,” Gunawardena said at a press briefing on Tuesday (2) to announce cabinet decisions of the week.
“So to strengthen these ties between the two nations further, the cabinet approved the foreign minister’s proposal of establishing a High Commission in Wellington.”
According to the Sri Lanka export development board, New Zealand is the 51st export destination for Sri Lanka.
Sri Lanka mainly exports items including tea packets, rubber tires and tubes, and textiles to New Zealand EDB data showed. (Colombo/Jan3/2024)
